name: Aillén (Ellen, Aillene)
sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Irish lore mentions an individual named Aillén, also spelt as Ellen and Aillene, who is depicted as a hero, heroine, or spirit. The name, which can be traced back to the words meaning “sprite” and “monster”, has been attached to numerous legendary identities in Irish mythology. There are several identities that share a striking resemblance to one another, which leads to speculation that they either refer to the same individual or are modifications of a common ancestor.
